column2: VERMONT DMV WRITTEN TEST
Question Text
1. To avoid the risk of being involved in an alcohol-related crash, you should:
column4: decide before you start drinking that you are not going to drive.
column6: say “No, thanks" if someone offers you alcohol.
column8: call a taxi if you've been drinking.

column2: 2. This road sign warns drivers that:
column4: the one-way street or roadway is about to change to two-way traffic.
column8: they are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.

column2: 3. What does it mean If an oncoming driver flashes headlights at you during a period of low visibility?
column4: Your vehicle was difficult to see. You should turn on your headlights.
column6: Your headlights are too bright. You should turn them off.
column8: You are driving in the wrong direction. Make a U-turn as soon as possible.
column10: Your headlights are too bright. You should use parking lights instead.

column2: 4. When an aggressive driver confronts you, you should:
column4: Report aggressive drivers to law enforcement authorities.

column2: 5. If an aggressive driver cuts you off, you should:
column6: look towards the left side of the road.
column10: stay calm and get out of the aggressive driver's way.

column2: 6. The picture shows:
7. If you need to slow down while driving on a slippery road, you should first:
column6: take your foot off the gas pedal.

column2: 8. If you drive much slower than the posted speed limit you:
column6: always have the right of way.
column8: are driving safely and can avoid tailgaters.

column2: 9. To keep your vehicle from rolling into traffic when parked on a hill, if you are facing uphill you should:
column4: set the parking brake and keep the front wheels straight.
column6: turn the front wheels towards the curb or edge of the road.
column8: turn the back wheels towards the curb or edge of the road.
column10: turn the front wheels away from the curb or edge of the road.

column2: 10. This sign is a:
11. This road sign means:
12. Double solid lines on the roadway mean:
column8: you can not go across the lines except to turn left to enter or leave the highway.

column2: 13. Directions given by traffic officers ___________ signs, signals or pavement markings.
14. High beam headlights should be used at night:
column4: when there are no oncoming vehicles.

column2: 15. A traffic sign with a red circle around and a slash over a symbol means:
column4: Do not drive faster than the posted speed limit.
column6: the maneuver shown on the sign should be executed with extreme caution.
column8: the maneuver shown by the symbol is not allowed.
column10: the maneuver shown on the sign can be executed only after coming to a complete stop.

column2: 16. What should you do when an aggressive driver confronts you?
column6: Challenge the aggressive driver with increased speed.
column10: Avoid eye contact with the aggressive driver.

column2: 17. To drive defensively, you must:
column6: assume that a driver who approaches a STOP sign on a side road is actually going to stop.
column8: not check behind you through your mirrors.
column10: use only one hand on the wheel.

column2: 18. The following symptoms are associated with drowsy driving:
column4: Your eyes go out of focus by themselves.
column8: You don’t remember driving the last few miles.

column2: 19. This road sign means:
20. What is the purpose of minimum speed limits?
column4: To decrease the state average speed statistic.
column8: To allow emergency vehicles with red flashing lights to safely pass other vehicles.
column10: To keep a smooth traffic flow.
